extendedIngredients.name: honey
salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 (6 oz.) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipes.title: Chicken with Honey Beer Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil to the pan and swirl to coat. Season chicken with salt and pepper on both sides. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for about 6 minutes per side, or until cooked through. This will depend on the thickness of your chicken breasts. Remove from pan and keep warm. Add the shallots to the pan and cook for about 1 minute. Add the beer, soy sauce, mustard and honey to the skillet and bring to a boil, making sure to scrape up any browned bits. Cook until the liquid has reduced to ½ cup, about 3 minutes. Return chicken to the skillet and coat with sauce. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately, spooning additional sauce over the chicken.

steps.step: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add oil to the pan and swirl to coat. Season chicken with salt and pepper on both sides.
Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for about 6 minutes per side, or until cooked through. This will depend on the thickness of your chicken breasts.
Remove from pan and keep warm.
Add the shallots to the pan and cook for about 1 minute.

Add the beer, soy sauce, mustard and honey to the skillet and bring to a boil, making sure to scrape up any browned bits. Cook until the liquid has reduced to ½ cup, about 3 minutes. Return chicken to the skillet and coat with sauce. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately, spooning additional sauce over the chicken.
